body.p: The third little piggie had no idea of the horrors his brothers faced. He was very comfortable in his new home and was cooking a stew over a large, open fire.

fig.title: The third little pig, cooking up a storm!

image.alt: photo of a pig cooking a stew over a fire

body.p: The two little piggies stormed into the third little piggies home. They told him all about the wolf that had tried to eat them! The little pig replied, "Everyone gets hungry, maybe he is really not so bad!"

The wolf was now very angry. He was still very hungry, and he smelled the most delicious smell coming from the third little piggies brick house. He thought to himself, "I have blown down two houses already, I bet I can blow down this house too!"
The wolf peered through the window and saw all three piggies together. He thought, "Yum! Appetizer, dinner, and dessert!"
The wolf peered through the window and saw the last little piggie cooking. He thought, "Yum! Dessert! And I can take home a stew for my kids!"
The wolf knocked on the door and asked:

The wolf huffed and puffed and the house didn't budge. He knew he may have to use a little more gusto. He huffed and puffed again, and the house still did not budge. The wolf became very angry. Very angry wolf
